page.title: 05Stowford House and Farm
page.content: The{R.A.S.E.}(Royal Agricultural Society of England) own the{Stowford {Farm}grounds ,which are about 130 acres.An average sized farm.Living in the house are 14 people ,which include 5 students ,1 working student and 2 families of 4.One of the families are the Masons.Mr Mason is the farm manager. The actual farm is a{livestock farm ,there are about 50 cows ,300 sheep ,450 lambs and 1 bull.The cows are mainly Fresians but there are some other breeds.The calves are sold to other farms to be stored.The sheep and lambs are also sold but another income is their wool which is sold to a {Dartington factory}.The farm has grazing rights on{dartmoor}from about July-September.This can cause problems as disease can spread very easily.
